result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Matthew Barnes

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Angelo M. Barnes - #2022003243, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas M Weege appeared by video for Angelo Matthew Barnes.  Attorney Annie Louk appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned for final pretrial, VIA ZOOM, and for jury trial, IN PERSON, in Branch 16.  Any final pretrial documents to be filed by January 10, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Weege appeared by video means. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court, defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of John Rejowski for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied bail motion for todays purposes. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes in court with Attorney Nicholas M Weege; both appear by video.  Defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: South Milwaukee Investigator M. Kramer. Court took judicial notice of 15CF3064. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Nicholas Weege receive and filed

Defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SPD needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Angelo Matthew Barnes in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
